DataElement.preferredName: Cancer Outcome EORTC Quality of Life Questionnaire-Core 30 Assessment Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas._The result of an action._An integrated system for assessing the quality of life of cancer patients participating in clinical trials and other types of research. It incorporates five functional scales: Physical, Role, Cognitive, Emotional, and Social Functioning; three symptom scales: Fatigue, Pain, and Nausea/Vomiting; a Global Health Status/QoL scale; and six single item scales: Dyspnea, Insomnia, Appetite Loss, Constipation, Diarrhea, and Financial Difficulties._a free text field to specify information on the evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Malignant Neoplasm Outcome EORTC Quality of Life Questionnaire-Core 30
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas._The result of an action._An integrated system for assessing the quality of life of cancer patients participating in clinical trials and other types of research. It incorporates five functional scales: Physical, Role, Cognitive, Emotional, and Social Functioning; three symptom scales: Fatigue, Pain, and Nausea/Vomiting; a Global Health Status/QoL scale; and six single item scales: Dyspnea, Insomnia, Appetite Loss, Constipation, Diarrhea, and Financial Difficulties.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.:The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: An integrated system for assessing the quality of life of cancer patients participating in clinical trials and other types of research. It incorporates five functional scales: Physical, Role, Cognitive, Emotional, and Social Functioning; three symptom scales: Fatigue, Pain, and Nausea/Vomiting; a Global Health Status/QoL scale; and six single item scales: Dyspnea, Insomnia, Appetite Loss, Constipation, Diarrhea, and Financial Difficulties.

Concepts.definition: An integrated system for assessing the quality of life of cancer patients participating in clinical trials and other types of research. It incorporates five functional scales: Physical, Role, Cognitive, Emotional, and Social Functioning; three symptom scales: Fatigue, Pain, and Nausea/Vomiting; a Global Health Status/QoL scale; and six single item scales: Dyspnea, Insomnia, Appetite Loss, Constipation, Diarrhea, and Financial Difficulties.
